value.verse: Give thanks to the LORD and call upon his Name; *
value.halfverse: make known his deeds among the peoples.

value.verse: Sing to him, sing praises to him, *
value.halfverse: and speak of all his marvelous works.
let the hearts of those who seek the LORD rejoice.
value.verse: Glory in his holy Name; *

value.halfverse: continually seek his face.
value.verse: Search for the LORD and his strength; *

value.halfverse: his wonders and the judgments of his mouth,
value.verse: Remember the marvels he has done, *
O offspring of Abraham his servant, *
value.halfverse: O children of Jacob his chosen.
his judgments prevail in all the world.
value.verse: He is the LORD our God; *
He has always been mindful of his covenant, *
value.halfverse: the promise he made for a thousand generations:
the oath that he swore to Isaac,
value.verse: The covenant he made with Abraham, *

value.halfverse: an everlasting covenant for Israel,
value.verse: Which he established as a statute for Jacob, *

value.halfverse: to be your allotted inheritance.”
value.verse: Saying, “To you will I give the land of Canaan *

value.halfverse: of little account, and sojourners in the land,
value.verse: When they were few in number, *

value.halfverse: and from one kingdom to another,
value.verse: Wandering from nation to nation *
He let no one oppress them *
value.halfverse: and rebuked kings for their sake,
and do my prophets no harm.”
value.verse: Saying, “Do not touch my anointed *
Then he called for a famine in the land *
value.halfverse: and destroyed the supply of bread.
Joseph, who was sold as a slave.
value.verse: He sent a man before them, *

value.halfverse: his neck they put in an iron collar.
value.verse: They bruised his feet in fetters; *
Until his prediction came to pass, *
value.halfverse: the word of the LORD tested him.
the ruler of the peoples set him free.
value.verse: The king sent and released him; *

value.halfverse: as a ruler over all his possessions,
value.verse: He set him as a master over his household, *

value.halfverse: and to teach his elders wisdom.
value.verse: To instruct his princes according to his will *

value.halfverse: and Jacob became a sojourner in the land of Ham.
value.verse: Israel came into Egypt, *

value.halfverse: he made them stronger than their enemies;
value.verse: The LORD made his people exceedingly fruitful; *

value.halfverse: and dealt unjustly with his servants.
value.verse: Whose heart he turned, so that they hated his people, *
He sent Moses his servant, *
value.halfverse: and Aaron whom he had chosen.

value.verse: They worked his signs among them, *
value.halfverse: and portents in the land of Ham.
but the Egyptians rebelled against his words.
value.verse: He sent darkness, and it grew dark; *
He turned their waters into blood *
value.halfverse: and caused their fish to die.

value.verse: Their land was overrun by frogs, *
value.halfverse: in the very chambers of their kings.
and gnats within all their borders.
value.verse: He spoke, and there came swarms of insects *
He gave them hailstones instead of rain, *
value.halfverse: and flames of fire throughout their land.

value.verse: He blasted their vines and their fig trees *
value.halfverse: and shattered every tree in their country.

value.verse: He spoke, and the locust came, *
value.halfverse: and young locusts without number,

value.verse: Which ate up all the green plants in their land *
value.halfverse: and devoured the fruit of their soil.
the firstfruits of all their strength.
value.verse: He struck down the firstborn of their land, *

value.halfverse: in all their tribes there was not one that stumbled.
value.verse: He led out his people with silver and gold; *

value.halfverse: because they were afraid of them.
value.verse: Egypt was glad of their going, *

value.halfverse: and a fire to give light in the night season.
value.verse: He spread out a cloud for a covering *

value.halfverse: and he satisfied them with bread from heaven.
value.verse: They asked, and quails appeared, *

value.halfverse: so the river ran in the dry places.
value.verse: He opened the rock, and water flowed, *

value.halfverse: and Abraham his servant.
value.verse: For God remembered his holy word *
So he led forth his people with gladness, *
value.halfverse: his chosen with shouts of joy.

value.verse: He gave his people the lands of the nations, *
value.halfverse: and they took the fruit of others’ toil,

and observe his laws.
 Hallelujah!
value.verse: That they might keep his statutes *
